subject: Technology
title: Uber and On-Demand Everything
description: A 60-second lesson on Uber and On-Demand Everything.

hook.text: Before Uber, getting a taxi meant standing on a corner waving your arm and hoping one would stop.

buildup.text: Uber connected riders and drivers through GPS. A tap on your phone and a car appeared in minutes.

discovery.text: Surge pricing used algorithms to raise fares when demand spiked. Riders hated it but drivers loved it.

twist.text: Uber lost billions of dollars for years. It prioritized growth over profit, betting the market would tip.

climax.text: The Uber model spread to food delivery, groceries, and even dog walking. On-demand became the norm.

punchline.text: One app replaced the taxi stand and inspired an entire economy.
